q: The NFL star whose name became synonymous with dogfighting is scheduled to be a guest on the The Oprah Winfrey Show. The daytime talk show host's interview with Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Michael Vick is set to air Thursday. Officials with Chicago-based Harpo Productions say the interview will cover Michael Vick 's time in prison

Chrysler emerged from bankruptcy in June 2009 and is now under the management control of Italy's Fiat SpA, which has a 25 percent stake in the U.S. automaker. Sergio Marchionne is also CEO of Fiat. As the only parties willing to underwrite the risk associated with Chrysler's recovery plan, the two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions, Sergio Marchionne said. comics including David Letterman . Paul Shaffer , David Letterman 's musical director, used to give a deadpan performance during his imitation of Don Kirshner on Saturday Night Live. Paul Shaffer and Don Kirshner worked together on the short-lived sitcom, A Year at the Top, according to Paul Shaffer 's manager. Mr. Andy Coulson , in a statement, said:`` It's been a privilege and an honor to work for David Cameron ,'' and added that nothing is more important than the government's task of getting this country back on its feet. `` Unfortunately,'' he said,'' continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role

Šarūnas Jasikevičius threw an inbound pass to Stephen Jackson , who went around a stumbling Kyle Korver to make an uncontested Robert Horry .`` I was 0-for-infinity,'' Stephen Jackson said. I just wanted to make a Robert Horry . We knew they'd switch. I went backdoor and got to the basket. My teammates showed confidence in me to give me the ball. It seemed like I hadn't made a Robert Horry all game. Stephen Jackson missed 15 of his first 19 Robert Horrys before the easy layup. Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
